turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's the big client in Japan, and it's the middle of the morning there and their whole system is crashed... this guy's having a meltdown--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What'd you do, honey?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well I pull out the manual on their setup, which is the new 680 server...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ...and I'm troubleshooting it with them over the phone... talking to a translator, right, who's getting half of it wrong... it was unbelievable...  really wild.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It sounds wild.  So now you're a big hero, right?  For fixing their system.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: My husband the hero.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I was in the area, and I thought you might like to have lunch.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: They must've just missed me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They said you had to run out.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yeah.  It was a rush thing.  They needed some documents down at the court house.  I barely made it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So, a little excitement in an otherwise dull day.  Did is work out okay?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, sure.  Fine.  I'll get some more gravy.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I thought we might have lunch tomorrow.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I can't, honey.  I promised Allison I'd go shopping with her. Sorry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How long have you been a member of his faction?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know anything about a faction.  I just met Simon...  or whatever his name is...  a couple of weeks ago.  I barely know him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What did happen?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Three days later, he called me. He told me to meet him at Overlook Park.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why did you continue to see him?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He needed my help.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Not because you were attracted to him?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You weren't attracted to him at all?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, maybe a little.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Tell me about your husband, Mrs Tasker.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Harry?  What can I say about Harry?  He's a sales rep for a computer company.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Would you say he was boring, then?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yeah.  I suppose he is.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's none of your goddamn business!  What kind of questions are these?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're in a lot of trouble, Mrs. Tasker, so I suggest you cooperate.  If we want to know the most intimate details of your life, you'd better tell us.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let me handle this part.  Do you mind?  Why did you go to Carlos' hideout?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He wanted me to go with him on a mission, to pose as him wife.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And you agreed?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I guess I needed something...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What did you need?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I needed to feel alive.  I wanted to do something...  outrageous. And... I don't know... it felt good to be needed.  To be trusted.  To be special.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This Simon.  Did you sleep with him?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Let me out of her!  Right now!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Answer the question--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Do you still love your husband?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Louder please.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I love him.  I have always loved him and I will always love him.  Can I go home, please?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, gee thanks.  Mmmm, let me see--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes or no.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What do you think?  Of course yes!  What's involved?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You will be contacted with the assignment.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: My husband can't know about this.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No one must know!  Especially him.  You must appear to live your life normally, conveying nothing.  The security of this nation depends on it.  Can you do that?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Think carefully.  You will be lying to the man you love.  The person who trusts you the most.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I can do it!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The code name of your contact will be Boris.  Your code name will be--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Natasha?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  Doris.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So last night was pretty exciting, huh?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What?  Oh, the flat tire?  Yeah, I thought the damn towtruck was never going to get there.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Allison is sick in bed.  I have to go over there, honey.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure, hon.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Now slide the nylons off one by one.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm not wearing any.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He's got nothing to do with this. It's me you want, right?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let the hooker go.  She's not important.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Harry, be quiet.  Let me handle this.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What were you doing there?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You wouldn't believe me.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Harry, what's the matter with you?  Tell them the truth.  We're married, we have a daughter--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't know what this crazy bitch is on.  You should just cut her loose, so we can get down to business.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Oh yeah?  Then where did I get this?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry, honey.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Don't call me honey!  You don't ever get to call me honey again. You understand?!  You pig!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What did he give you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sodium amytal, maybe some other truth agent.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It makes you tell the truth?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is it working yet?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ask me a question I would normally lie to.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Are we going to die?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yup.										*

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: 17 years.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: My God.  Have you had to...  have sex with other women in the line of duty?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't take those assignments.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What about Juno?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's really a fox, isn't she?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Did you pork her Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  But I wanted to.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Are you a total lying, scumsucking pig Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Looks that way.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: God, you have great legs.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Harry... snap out of it!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tell me something before this stuff wears off and you start lying again.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Do you still love me?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: As much as you used to?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  Much more.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: If we're on an island, why are they using trucks?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We must be in the Florida Keys .				* .  .  the Overseas Highway					* connects the islands to the mainland.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Go down there and kill everybody, I guess.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh shit.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Wait here.  If you have to use this, use it.  Don't choke. Okay?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: ... you should have seen your father, standing there all covered with spaghetti sauce.  He looked like such a dope.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I told the guy---  I told the guy, this isn't even my order.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Not yet.  But we'll find him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Dance?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: What're we talking about here? Pussy, right?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Let's face it, Harry, the Vette gets 'em wet.  But it's not enough.  If you want to really close escrow, you gotta have an angle.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And you've got one.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: It's killer.  Look at me-- I'm not that much to look at.  No really.  I can be honest.  But I got 'em lining up, and not just skanks, either.  Some are.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So what's your angle?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Sorry.  Trade secret.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure.  Set me up and then don't tell me.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Okay, just ask yourself.  What do women really want?  You take these bored housewives, married to the same guy for years.  Stuck in a rut.  They need some release.  The promise of adventure.  A hint of danger.  I create that for them.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So you're basically lying your ass off the whole time?  I couldn't do it.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Well, think of it as playing a role.  It's fantasy.  You have to work on their dreams.  Get them out of their daily suburban grind for a few hours.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Isn't that hard to keep up, in the long run?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Doesn't matter.  I like change. You know, constant turnover.  As soon as I close the deal, it's one of two more times, then adios.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Use 'em and lose 'em.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Exactly.  The trick is, you gotta pick your target.  They have to be nice little housewife types. School-teachers.  But, I'm telling you, you get their pilot lit, these babes, they can suck- start a leaf-blower.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What about the husbands?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Dickless.  If they took care of				* business, I'd be out of business, know what I mean?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Those idiots.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You working on someone right now?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I always have a couple on the hook.  You know.  There's one right now, I've got her panting like a dog.  It's great.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What does she do?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Some kinda legal secretary of something.  Married to some boring jerk.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: But with you, she gets to be hot, right?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Red hot.  Her thighs steam.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sooooo... she's pretty good in bed, then?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Hey, slow down you're gonna miss the turn!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: See.  You and this car were meant for each other.  Why fight it? Sure, I have a couple other buyers lined up, but I like your style.  Whattya say?  Should we start on the paperwork?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let me think about it.  Hold it a day for me?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Yeeaoowww!!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You son of a bitch.  Did you really think you could elude us forever, Carlos?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Wait!  You got the wrong guy.  My name's Simon.  Look, just let me go.  There's no need to kill me. I haven't seen your--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Beat it.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No.  Soon as I turn you'll shoot me.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: I said SIT DOWN.  Who do you work for?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Kettleman, Barnes and McGrath. I'm a legal secretary.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Of course.  Mrs. Tasker.  And what were you going with the international terrorist, Carlos the Jackal?  Taking dictation?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He said he was an American agent.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Get going!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Uh... well, okay then.  You sound terrible.  I'll run out right now.  Just call the prescription in to the pharmacy.  Sure, no problem.  Bye.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Boris and Doris?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Who's your little friend?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm Helen Tasker.  Harry's my husband.  And you are?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: So now it's Tasker?  Not Renquist?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Look, Harry's not part of this. He's just a sales rep.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No, my dear, he is a federal agent.  He killed two of my colleagues the other night.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: No, you don't understand, we've been married for 15 years--

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What's going on, Harry?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Samir is just going to ask Harry a few questions.  See, we're not even sure which agency Harry works for.  Now, Samir is absolutely first class, but on the other hand we have Harry, here, who has managed to lie convincingly to the woman he loves for 15 years.  So it will be interesting to see how long he can resist.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Now just keep your knees together, and you'll be fine.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Something you obviously have a hard time doing!

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Hold that thought.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: Like one?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Helen?  It's Simon.  Is it safe to talk?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.  Go ahead.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.  I suppose so.  Where?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: The same place.  One o'clock.  I have to go now.  See you tomorrow.  Remember, I need you.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Are you sure you weren't followed?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I kept looking back, like you taught me.  I didn't see anyone.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Okay.  It's just, things are a bit hot for me right now.  If I get a signal...  I may have to leave suddenly.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: It's my job to risk my life, but not yours.  I feel bad about bringing you into this, but you're the only one I can trust.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where were you?  On a... uh,					* mission?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Ssshhh!  We say Op.  Covert					* operation.  And this one got a little rough.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Worse than Cairo?							*

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Cairo was a day at the beach next				* to this.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Did you read the papers yesterday?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Sometimes a story is a mask for a covert operation.  See-- two men killed in a restroom, and two unidentified men in a running					* shootout, ending at the						* Marriot...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That was you?!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You recognized my style.  See, you're very good.  You're a natural at this.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Tell me what happened?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You can trust me completely.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I know.  But it would compromise your safety too much to know certain things.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Right, of course.  I was worried when I didn't hear from you that night.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: It's strange.  I knew I was in a woman's thoughts when I was shooting it out with those assassins.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Were they trying to kill you?					*

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Three of them.  Hardly worth					* talking about.  Two won't bother				* me again.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: And you chased one?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Something came over me, I just had nail him, no matter what the				* risk.  It was pretty hairy.  I thought he had me, a couple of					* times.  But I really can't take credit .  .  .

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What is it you want me to do?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Not here.  I'll call you and we'll rendezvous again.  We have to leave separately, so we aren't seen together.  For your safety.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You'll call me then?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Yes.  Now go.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What's happened?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: It's serious.  That's all I can				* say.  Just meet on K Street under				* the Key Bridge.  At eight sharp.				*

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: To our assignment.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What is it you need me to do?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Helen, I want you to be my wife.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm married!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Just for the operation in Paris. I need to be married.  They'll be looking for a man traveling alone.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: We're going to Paris?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Helen, there's a double agent in my outfit... I don't know who. There's no one I can trust. Except you.  Can you get away? Just for two days.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't know.  I have to think...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Here.  Sit down.  Be comfortable.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You see what I mean?  That reaction would give us away in a second.  Try to relax.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's just that... it's been sixteen years since anyone but Harry did that, I--

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Relax.  There, that's better. Let yourself slip into the role.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Thank you.  You saved my life. What's your name?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Helen.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You can call me Simon.  You're very brave to do this...  You opened it.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I just glances inside.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: It's a good thing you pay me well.

turns.speaker: MALIK
turns.text: Do you realize that there are surveillance teams watching this place right now?  Your phones are almost certainly tapped.  And you are busy laughing and flirting like a whore with this Renquist, who may be a--

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: No.  He checked out okay--

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: MALIK
turns.text: Find out who this Renquist it.

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: MALIK
turns.text: Use the gifts that Allah has given you.

turns.speaker: MALIK
turns.text: Who is this woman?

turns.speaker: JUNO
turns.text: His wife.

turns.speaker: MALIK
turns.text: His wife?  Good.  Bring them.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Hi, Dick. I'm Alabama Worley.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Hello, Alabama.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I can't wait to meet you. Clarence told me all about you. He said you were his best friend. So, I guess that makes you my best friend, too.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: He said don't go nowhere. We'll be there some time tomorrow.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Wait a minute -

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Did you get the letter?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: What letter?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: What letter?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Gotten your mail yet?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Yeah, my room-mate leaves it on the TV.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Let me speak to Clarence.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: He wants to speak with you.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: You're gonna be on "T.J. Hooker"?

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Knock wood.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: That was so good I am gonna have another.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You can't have just one.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: Holy Mary, Mother of God.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: This is great, we got cable.

turns.speaker: DICK
turns.text: You got that playing basketball?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Yeah. I got elbowed right in the eye. And if that wasn't enough, I got hurled the ball when I'm not looking. Wam! Right in my face.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I'm pretty hungry. When I went to the store I was gonna get some Ding-Dongs.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Well, fuck that shit, we'll get some real food. What would taste good.  What do you think would taste good?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: This should cover it, Auggie-Doggie.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Okee-dokee, Doggie-Daddy.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: The forager's back.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Thank God. I could eat a horse if you slap enough catsup on it.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I didn't get any chicken.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: How come?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: It's nine o'clock in the morning. Nothing's open.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Bye, Daddy! Hope to see you again real soon.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What kind of daughterly smackeroo was that?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Oh, hush up.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Tell him we gotta go.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Clarence says we gotta be hittin' it.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Tell him not to eat anything. We're gonna scarf when we get there.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Don't eat anything.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: The letter I sent.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: The letter he sent.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Has he looked through it yet?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Ya looked through it?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Tell him to look through it.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Get it.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: No time. Gotta go. Just tell him to read the letter, the letter explains all. Tell him I love him. And tell him, as of tomorrow, all his money problems are over.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: He can't. We gotta go, but he wants you to read the letter. The letter explains it all. He wants you to know he loves you. And he wants you to know that as of tomorrow, all of your money problems are over.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Bye-bye.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Now hang up.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: ... when my mom went into labor, my dad panicked. He never had a kid before, and crashed the car. Now, picture this: their car's demolished, crowd is starting to gather, my mom is yelling, going into contractions, and my dad, who was losing it before, is now completely screaming yellow zonkers. Then, out of nowhere, as if from thin air, this big giant bus appears, and the bus-driver says, "Get her in here.". He forgot all about his route and just drove straight to the hospital. So, because he was such a nice guy, they wanted to name the baby after him, as a sign of gratitude. Well, his name was Waldo, and no matter how grateful they were, even if I'da been a boy, they would't call me Waldo. So they asked Waldo where he was from. And, so there you go.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: And here we are.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Oh, look what happened. Oh god, I'm so sorry. Are you OK?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Yeah. I'm fine. It didn't hurt.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I'm the clumsiest person in the world.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: It's OK. Don't worry about it. Accidents happen.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: What a wonderful philosophy. Thanks for being such a sweetheart. You could have been a real dick.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Not at all. I, this guy here, he's Sonny Chiba.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: The oriental.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: The oriental in black. He's an assasin. Now, at the beginning he was hired to kill this guy the cops had. So he got himself arrested. They take him into the police station. And he starts kickin' all the cops' asses. Now, while keepin' them at bay, he finds the guy he was supposed to kill. Does a number on him. Kicks the cops' asses some more. Kicks the bars out of the window. And jumps out into a getaway car that was waiting for him.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Want some Goobers?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I thought Sonny was the good guy.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: He ain't so much good guy as he's just a bad motherfucker. Sonny don't be bullshittin'. He fucks dudes up for life. Hold on, a fight scene's coming up.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Great movie. Action-packed!

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Does Sonny kick ass or does Sonny kick ass?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Sonny kicks ass.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: You shoulda saw the first original uncut version of the "Streetfighter". It was the only movie up to that time rated X for violence. But we just saw the R.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: If that was the R, I'd love to see the X.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: My name is Clarence, and what is yours?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Alabama Whitman. Pleased to meet ya.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Is that your real name? Really?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: That's my real name, really. I got proof. See.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Where's your car? I'll walk you to it.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I took a cab.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: You took a cab to see three kung fu movies?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Sure. Why not?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Nothing. It's just you're a girl after my own heart.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: 'Bout twelve.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I suppose you gotta get up early, huh?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: No. Not particularly.  How come?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Well, it's just when I see a really good movie I really like to go out and get some pie, and talk about it. It's sort of tradition. Do you like to eat pie after you've seen a good movie?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: I love to get pie after a movie.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Would you like to get some pie?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: I'd love some pie.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Well, enough about the King. How about you?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: How 'bout me what?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Tell me about yourself.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: There's nothing to tell.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: C'mon. What're ya tryin' to be? The Phantom Lady?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Well, for starters, what do you do? Where're ya from? What's your favorite color? Who's your favorite movie star? What kinda music do you like? What are your turn-ons and turn-offs? Do you have a fella? What's the story behind you takin' a cab to the most dangerous part of town alone? And, in a theater full of empty seats, why did you sit by me?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Ask me them again. One by one.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I don't remember.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Where are you from.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Might be from Tallahassee. But I'm not sure yet.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What's your favorite color?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I don't remember. But off the top of my head, I'd say black.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What's your favorite movie star?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Burt Reynolds.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Would you like a bite of my pie?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Yes, I would.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Like it?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Very much. Now, where were we?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What kinda music do you like?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Phil Spector. Girl group stuff. You know, like "He's a Rebel".

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What are your turn-ons?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Mickey Rourke, somebody who can appreciate the finer things in life, like Elvis's voice, good kung fu, and a tasty piece of pie.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Turn-offs?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I'm sure there must be something, but I don't really remember. The only thing that comes to mind are Persians.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Do you have a fella?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I'm not sure yet. Ask me again later.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: What's the story behind you takin' a cab to the most dangerous part of town alone?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Apparently, I was hit on the head with something really heavy, giving me a form of amnesia. When I came to, I didn't know who I was, where I was, or where I came from. Luckily, I had my driver's license or I wouldn't even know my name. I hoped it would tell me where I lived but it had a Tallahassee address on it, and I stopped somebody on the street and they told me I was in Detroit. So that was no help. But I did have some money on me, so I hopped in a cab until I saw somethin' that looked familiar. For some reason, and don't ask me why, that theater looked familiar. So I told him to stop and I got out.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: And in a theater full of empty seats, why did you sit by me?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Because you looked like a nice guy, and I was a little scared. And I sure couldda used a nice guy about that time, so I spilled my popcorn on you.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Wow. What a swell place to work.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Yeah, I got the key, so I come here at night, hang out, read comic books, play music.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: How long have you worked here?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Almost four years.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: That's a long time.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: I'm hip. But you know, I'm comfortable here. It's easy work. I know what I'm doing. Everybody who works here is my buddy. I'm friendly with most of the customers. I just hang around and talk about comic books all day.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: Do you get paid a lot?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: That's where trouble comes into paradise. But the boss let's you borrow some money if you need it. Wanna see what "Spiderman" number one looks like?

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: You bet. How much is that worth?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Four hundred bucks.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: I didn't even know they had stores that just sold comic books.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: Well, we sell other things too. Cool stuff. "Man from U.N.C.L.E." Lunch boxes. "Green Hornet" board games. Shit like that. But comic books are main business. There's a lot of collectors around here.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: That's a "Rookies" doll. George Sanford Brown. We gotta lotta dolls. They're real cool. Did you know they came out with dolls for all the actors in "The Black Hole"? I always found it funny somewhere there's a kid playin' with a little figure of Earnest Borgnine.

turns.speaker: ALABAMA
turns.text: God, Spiderman looks different.

turns.speaker: CLARENCE
turns.text: He was just born, remember? This is the first one. You know that guy, Dr. Gene Scott? He said that the story of Spiderman is the story of Christ, just disguised. Well, I thought about that even before I heard him say it. Hold on, let me show you my favorite comic book cover of all time.
